DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study was to compare the efficacy, toleration and safety of eletriptan 40mg and 80mg, with sumatriptan 25mg and 50mg, and placebo when given orally to subjects with an acute migraine.
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Study of Oral Eletriptan (40mg and 80mg), Oral Sumatriptan (25mg and 50mg) and Placebo
DOC.criteria: Subjects who expected to suffer at least one acute attack of migraine, with or without aura, each 6 weeks (The diagnosis of migraine was to comply with the criteria proposed by the International Headache Society (IHS)) Subjects capable of taking medication as outpatients, and recording the effects of such medication. Pregnant or breastfeeding women Migraine subjects who also suffered from concomitant frequent (nonmigrainous) headache, defined as more than six attacks per month on average.
